instrupy.synthetic_aperture_radar_model.SyntheticApertureRadarModel¶

class instrupy.synthetic_aperture_radar_model.SyntheticApertureRadarModel(name=None, mass=None, volume=None, power=None, orientation=None, fieldOfViewGeometry=None, sceneFieldOfViewGeometry=None, maneuver=None, pointingOption=None, dataRate=None, bitsPerPixel=None, pulseWidth=None, antenna=None, operatingFrequency=None, peakTransmitPower=None, chirpBandwidth=None, minimumPRF=None, maximumPRF=None, radarLoss=None, atmosLoss=None, sceneNoiseTemp=None, systemNoiseFigure=None, polType=None, dualPolPulseConfig=None, dualPolPulseSep=None, swathType=None, scanTechnique=None, fixedSwathSize=None, numSubSwaths=None, _id=None)[source]¶

A synthetic aperture radar model class.

Variables

  • L_r (float) – Reduction in SNR gain due to non-ideal range filtering (see [Pg.9, 1]). Default value is 1.2.

  • L_a (float) – Reduction in SNR gain due to non-ideal azimuth filtering (see [Pg.10, 1]). Default value is 1.2.

  • a_wa (float) – Azimuth impulse response broadening factor (see [Pg.9, 1]). Default value is 1.2.

  • a_wr (float) – Range impulse response broadening factor (see [Pg.10, 1]). Default value is 1.2.

  • name (str) – Full name of the instrument.

  • mass (float) – Total mass (kg) of this entity.

  • volume (float) – Total volume (m3) of this entity.

  • power (float) – Nominal operating power (W).

  • orientation (instrupy.util.Orientation) – Orientation of the instrument.

  • fieldOfView (instrupy.util.ViewGeometry) – Field of view of instrument specification (SphericalGeometry and Orientation).

  • sceneFieldOfView – Scene field of view specification (SphericalGeometry and Orientation).

  • maneuver (instrupy.util.Maneuver) – Maneuver specification of the instrument.

  • fieldOfRegard (list, instrupy.util.ViewGeometry) – Field of regard of the instrument taking into account the sensor FOV and manueverability of the satellite-sensor system. Note that this shall be a list in order to accommodate non-intersecting view-geometries.

  • pointing_option (list, orbitpy.util.Orientation) – List of Orientation objects which specify the orientations into which the instrument-axis can be maneuvered. The orientation must be specified in the NADIR_POINTING frame.

  • dataRate (float) – Rate of data recorded (Mega-bits-per-sec) during nominal operations.

  • bitsPerPixel (int) – Number of bits encoded per pixel of image.

  • pulseWidth (float) – Actual pulse width in (seconds) (per channel/polarization).

  • antenna (instrupy.util.Antenna) – Antenna specifications. Only rectangular shape and uniform aperture excitation profile is accepted.

  • operatingFrequency (float) – Operating radar center frequency in (Hertz).

  • peakTransmitPower (float) – Peak transmit power in (Watts).

  • chirpBandwidth (float) – Chirp bandwidth of radar operation in (Hertz) (per channel/polarization).

  • minimumPRF (float) – The minimum allowable pulse-repetition-frequency of operation in (Hertz). If dual-pol with alternating pol pulses, the PRF specification is considered taking all pulses into account (i.e. is considered as the PRFmaster).

  • maximumPRF (float) – The maximum allowable pulse-repetition-frequency of operation in (Hertz). If dual-pol with alternating pol pulses, the PRF specification is considered taking all pulses into account (i.e. is considered as the PRFmaster).

  • sceneNoiseTemp (float) – Nominal scene noise temperature in (Kelvin).

  • systemNoiseFigure (float) – (decibels) System noise figure for the receiver. The system noise figure includes primarily the noise figure of the front-end Low-Noise Amplifier (LNA) and the losses between the antenna and the LNA. Typical system noise figures for sub-kilowatt radar systems are 3.0 dB to 3.5 dB at X-band, 3.5 dB to 4.5 dB at Ku-band, and perhaps 6 dB at Ka-band. See [Pg.15, 1].

  • radarLoss (float) – (decibels) These include a variety of losses primarily over the microwave signal path, but doesn’t include the atmosphere. Included are a power loss from transmitter power amplifier output to the antenna port, and a two-way loss through the radome. Typical numbers might be 0.5 dB to 2 dB from TX amplifier to the antenna port, and perhaps an additional 0.5 dB to 1.5 dB two-way through the radome. See [Pg.15, 1].

  • atmosLoss (float) – 2-way atmospheric loss of electromagnetic energy (see [Pg.16, 1]).

  • polType (instrupy.synthetic_aperture_radar_model.PolTypeSAR) – SAR polarization type.

  • dualPolPulseConfig (DualPolPulseConfig or None) – In case of dual-pol, this parameter indicates the pulse configuration.

  • dualPolPulseSep (float or None) – In case of SMAP dual-pol configuration, this parameter indicates the pulse separation in seconds.

  • scanTechnique (instrupy.synthetic_aperture_radar_model.ScanTech) – Scanning technique.

  • swathType (instrupy.synthetic_aperture_radar_model.SwathTypeSAR) – Swath configuration.

  • fixedSwathSize (float or None) – In case of SwathTypeSAR.FIXED swath configuration, this parameter indicates the size of the fixed swath in kilometers.

  • numSubSwaths (int or None) – Number of sub-swaths (scans) in case of “ScanSAR” operation.

  • _id (str or int) – Unique instrument identifier.
